snippet: Law enforcement officials in Mississippi said Sunday that they had arrested four people after the fatal shooting of two police officers in Hattiesburg, and that two of the suspects had been charged with capital murder.
abstract: Law enforcement officials in Mississippi say they have arrested four suspects after shooting deaths of police officers Benjamin Deen and Liquori Tate in Hattiesburg, Miss; suspects charged with murder are Marvin Banks and Joanie Calloway; other two detained are Cornelius Clark and Curtis Banks.

byline.contributor: Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Atlanta, and Liam Stack from New York.

lead_paragraph: Law enforcement officials in Mississippi said Sunday that they had arrested four people after the fatal shooting of two police officers in Hattiesburg, and that two of the suspects had been charged with capital murder.

headline.main: 4 Arrested After 2 Mississippi Police Officers Are Killed During Traffic Stop
headline.print_headline: 4 Arrested After 2 Mississippi Police Officers Are Killed During Traffic Stop
